timeline.message: Fix some format issues, and update the github workflows for the env related issues

timeline.bodyText: Could you remove this method since nobody calls it?
timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Actually it's used by our scheduled jobs.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: got it.
replies.author: kaituo

timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: The same as above
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: yes.
replies.author: kaituo

timeline.bodyText: Why do we want to have a different readable name than before?
timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: xContentBuilder.timeField this method changes the logic that exception will be thrown when raw and readable names are the same. This is one thing I wanna confirm with team: What readable  name should be used here?
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: The original code may have a mistake since we don't intend to provide two fields for the same information.  Can we just use timeField(String name, Object timeValue)?
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Yes, we can change it to timeField(String name, Object timeValue).  Do you see any negative impact for this change?
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: You can manually tested it by updating an detector and see if last_update_time is correct or not. If yes, we should be ok.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Don't think there is negative impact to remove readable name.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: Readable one is removed. The  timeField(String name, Object timeValue) method isn't compatible with other codes. To be consistent with previous version, use field method instead.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

timeline.bodyText: To ensure we have a clean state before each integ test, can you install certificate for the super user as https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/alerting/blob/master/alerting/src/test/kotlin/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/alerting/ODFERestTestCase.kt#L103-L124 ?
timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: It's not about super user. The deletion has been successful. Just a warning exception will be thrown as one system index is trying to be deleted. In future, this will be blocked.  I did try to use the strict mode to avoid this exception but it will block all of warning exceptions which might be not what we want. Instead here it will be only passed for this specific warning message. For long term plan, we probably need a new interface to delete the system indices
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Can you tell me how do you test on security enabled on?  I didn't know we can delete system index.  If yes, there seems to be a bug on the system index side.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: This warning is just introduced by the latest ES PR: elastic/elasticsearch#60945. It's not related to security feature. Currently security plugin isn't ready for 1.12.0. We need wait for it to run the testing against security enabled cluster.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: I see. I am afraid this call will likely fail and throw other exceptions when security is enabled.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Have you tested some REST API by run ./gradlew run ? Will we get the same exception?
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText:
Also see the warning message. My understanding is that in theory, direct access system indices isn't reasonable.
 curl -v  http://127.0.0.1:9200/.opendistro-anomaly-detectors
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 9200 (#0)
> GET /.opendistro-anomaly-detectors HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:9200
> User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Warning: 299 Elasticsearch-7.10.0-51e9d6f22758d0374a0f3f5c6e8f3a7997850f96 "this request accesses system indices: [.opendistro-anomaly-detectors], but in a future major version, direct access to system indices will be prevented by default"
< content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
< content-length: 1819
<
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
{".opendistro-anomaly-detectors":{"aliases":{},"mappings":{"dynamic":"false","_meta":{"schema_version":2},"properties":{"category_field":{"type":"keyword"},"description":{"type":"text"},"detection_interval":{"properties":{"period":```
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Based on discussion with Yaliang, there is no direct access from customer use cases. For these IT cases, we need change those before next major version. One issue is created to track this: #315
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: @kaituo is there any related change in security?  since the test cases have run successfully with security enabled cluster for 1.11.0 release, it should be ok unless there is some related change in security recently.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: security also has a concept called "system index", different from ES's "system index".  Only admin with certificates can access security's system index.  Sarat added it recently and should be included in 1.12.  Previous CI runs with a security plugin without Sarat's changes.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: I see, thanks. This is very helpful.  could it be tested with odfe 1.11.0 by rebuilding AD plugin?
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Tested on security cluster with both 1.11.0 and 1.12.0.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the change.
replies.author: kaituo

timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: yes. just one warning message
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this PR, but is it reasonable to use GENERIC executor to run AD cron job? Same question for AnomalyDetectionIndices.java line 443 return ThreadPool.Names.MANAGEMENT;
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: Good call. new issue is created: #316. Let's discuss it there.
replies.author: weicongs-amazon

timeline.message: Add test cluster for run command; remove duplicated item from release note; remove the readable name for AD
Use long value for last_update_time field
Update the IT for security changes
Fix IT cases for security enabled cluster
add new PR into the release note
remove numNode param which is useless for docker based integration test
